page.title: 06CORBY'S WOODS.
page.content: Once all Corby was inside the Rockingham Forest where Kings hunted. The bit of old woodland left still stands near the town centre behind the boating lake and across to Woodnewton Way.They are mostly oak trees,tall and fat. There are many pathways through them, from Woodnewton to Studfall, behind the Health Centre to Beanfield, and from the lake to the swimming baths.Many kids play there making dens and swings. The woods are not safe at night because of muggers and glue- sniffers. In the middle is a house with guard dogs running free in the garden. When we explored we heard blackbird chicks squawking & blackbirds singing. Early in the morning rabbits are eating on a small patch of grass. A grey squirrel was there. We heard an owl. Parts are being cut down and cleared, so wildlife is now at risk.
